intro: Sabatia obtusifolia, commonly known as purpletop, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Sabatia obtusifolia is an important plant for pollinators and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
